Posts.Content: On 2/11/2008 KATHY IN CALIFORNIA wrote: After a lumpectomy of a "non-agressive" type breast tumor (mucinous) and six weeks of radiation (completed 11 months ago)I've been doing pretty well.  About 6 weeks ago I noticed some changes in my breast.  Change in nipple color, (loss of pigment)  and a thickening of tissue. I've been in for an ultrasound and there didn't seem to be anything amiss.  Since then, more changes,( redness and swelling around it) that Doc says might be the result of the radiation but I should have another mammogram.  I'm trying to minimalize the tests/Dr.appts since I don't have insurance.  Anyone have a similar experience?  I've also been on aromasin for 10 months now too.  I could sure use some feed back. Thanks, worry wort? Please, please, push for more tests.  There is a breast cancer that presents with the symptoms that you just described.  It is called Inflammatory Breast Cancer, it is aggressive and often misdiagnosed.  This cancer presents with changes in your nipple and skin, redness and swelling in the breast.  Very difficult to diagnose with Mammogram.  I am very familiar with the symtoms of this cancer because I was diagnosed with it March 2007,  It could very well be nothing, I finished radiation 5 months ago and I am still having issues, mine tend to be more itching and redness, but it can be annoying. Thanks Donna LP
Posts.Title: question about radiation side effects 11 mo. later
